channel.title: Networking for Newbies | Overview
channel.description: Hello fellow 0x00ers! In this post, I am introducing my new series- **_"Networking for Newbies"._** When looking at networking basics, understanding the way a network operates is the first step to understanding it. In this series, I will give you an overview of the different terms and technologies commonly used. I will also include further links to help you understand the discussed topic better but researching and diving deep should be your work. This is the list of topics I will be covering in this series: * DHCP * NAT * Subnetting * IPv4 and IPv6 * Public vs Private IP * DNS * Routers & Switches * VLANs * OSI Model * MAC Addressing and the ARP Protocol Once you are familiar with these technologies, you should be able to use the tools related to network hacking in pen-testing distros with a lot more comfort. Also, this will help you to understand how the Internet actually works. Looking forward to the responses I get! ---------- Level: Beginner ---------- ---------- _If you see any topic I am missing here and is worth including, do reply here. Also, I would love to have suggestions!_

item.title: Networking for Newbies | Overview
item.dc:creator: the_c0nd0r
item.description:
Hello fellow 0x00ers! In this post, I am introducing my new series- “Networking for Newbies”.
When looking at networking basics, understanding the way a network operates is the first step to understanding it. In this series, I will give you an overview of the different terms and technologies commonly used. I will also include further links to help you understand the discussed topic better but researching and diving deep should be your work. This is the list of topics I will be covering in this series:

  • DHCP
  • NAT
  • Subnetting
  • IPv4 and IPv6
  • Public vs Private IP
  • DNS
  • Routers & Switches
  • VLANs
  • OSI Model
  • MAC Addressing and the ARP Protocol

Once you are familiar with these technologies, you should be able to use the tools related to network hacking in pen-testing distros with a lot more comfort. Also, this will help you to understand how the Internet actually works. Looking forward to the responses I get!

Level: Beginner

If you see any topic I am missing here and is worth including, do reply here. Also, I would love to have suggestions!

Read full topic
